title: Warsongs Copyright
body: Is there any issue if I were to use audio from Warsongs for, say, an intro? Or for background music for a stream? Just wondering if the music is copyrighted or not. Also, can such use of the music be monetized or no?

replies.body: If you like Warsongs enough to hit the play button while streaming and playing League - go for it!!! This may have been one of our goals when we developed this idea.

I believe you're able to utilize it for streams and youtube videos, the pentakill album is usable in such a way. There's a content creator by the name of HuzzyGames who utilizes pentakill on his stream for segments he intends to create separate videos with.

As far a monetizing it, I think only if it's indirect, meaning you couldn't create CDs and sell them, but you could say create a youtube video and suck up the ad revenue, or donations, even patreon stuff should be fine as well, so much as you're not selling the music itself as your product.

That's just my understanding of it though, I'm no lawyer or anything.
Oh sweet biscuits, I was wondering about that. I needed some sweet tunes when I record League and nice background music.
